questions.question: He consumed too much wine ………………… fell asleep.
questions.description: The clauses joined by and express relationships such as time, cause and effect, contrast and condition.

questions.question: Be your own person …………………… don’t imitate others.
She claims …………………….. she is in contact with the immaterial world.
questions.description: That can be a mere connector with no special meaning of its own.

questions.question: Cover your cough ……………………. you won’t spread germs.
questions.description: So indicates the purpose. Because and as indicate the reason.

questions.question: She was a kind woman ………………………… wouldn’t hurt a fly.
questions.description: When the relative pronoun is the subject of the relative clause we use who to refer to people.

questions.question: Put the seeds in wet sand ……………………….. they germinate.
That is an interesting point, ………………………. it is not relevant to our discussion.
questions.description: But is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: She was gesturing so excitedly …………………….. I knew something was wrong.
She has been limping ………………………… she injured her foot in the accident.
questions.description: Since is used to indicate the starting point of a situation.

questions.question: I hate to disappoint you, ………………………. your chances of winning are nil.
The police are looking for a woman ………………………… deserted her children.
The doctor insisted .................................. I stop smoking.
